translation: Today I’d like to talk about the story of children, especially the way my daughter and I traveled.
transcript: 今天想讲的呢，是一群孩子，特别我想讲一下我跟女儿一起走过的这段路。

translation: Six years ago, lots of people traveled this route, including many of my friends.
transcript: 那是在六年前，因为当时已经有很多的朋友，很多的队员走过这条路了。

translation: But no child had ever taken it, so it occurred to me that I wanted to take my daughter with me, as she liked to follow me everywhere when she was very little.
transcript: 但是那时候还没有孩子走过，诶，我就想到带着我的女儿，因为我女儿从小跟我也到处跑。

translation: Back then she was ten, so I decided to show her the Gobi Desert.
transcript: 那么那年正好十岁，我想我带她去看一看，体验一下戈壁。

translation: In the Gobi, we needed to cover a route of 120km within 4 days.
transcript: 在戈壁上呢，我们要用四天的时间走完120公里的全程。

translation: Basically the terrain looked like this: very bumpy.
transcript: 基本上的地貌就是这样的地貌，非常的坎坷。

translation: And this place is famous for its wind, nicknamed as "the most windy area in the world".
transcript: 而且这个地方呢是著名的风库，号称“世界风库”。

translation: If you pay a visit there now, you will find it has the largest wind farm in Asia.
transcript: 但是今天你去看，你会发现这里是亚洲最大的风电场。

translation: Why?
transcript: 因为什么？

translation: Because of its strong wind.
transcript: 风大。

translation: This meant we needed to walk in the wind.
transcript: 所以我们要在风当中要穿行。

translation: During the first three days, I would walk with grown-ups in the team while my daughter walked with her mother.
transcript: 前三天的时候因为有很多的成人，那我会和大人在一起走，那么我女儿呢和她妈妈在一起走。

translation: Then on the third night, my daughter told me, “Dad, I feel very frustrated.”
transcript: 到了第三天晚上，我女儿就跟我讲，说：“爸爸，我非常有挫折感。”

translation: The word “frustrated” she used left a lasting impression on me.
transcript: 我印象特别深，她用了一个词叫挫折感。

translation: She was only ten, so I wondered how could such a little girl feel frustrated?
transcript: 那个时候她十岁，我觉得十岁的小女孩居然有挫折感？

translation: So I talked with her, "Why? Why do you feel frustrated?"
transcript: 于是我就跟她探讨，我说：“为什么？你为什么会有挫折感？“

translation: She said, "I don't want to be the last in the team, but I am every day."
transcript: 她说：“因为我不想当最后一个，可是我每天都是最后一个。”

translation: I said, “It’s reasonable, there are only two children in this team, and you are the younger one.”
transcript: 我说：“这很正常啊，因为只有两个孩子，你是最小的那个。”

translation: “But I hate the feeling of being last,” my daughter said.
transcript: 她说：“但是我实在是不喜欢最后一名的感受。”

translation: “Then I will accompany you tomorrow, we will try to walk as fast as we can, and we won’t be last.”
transcript: 我说：“好，那明天爸爸带着你走，我带着你走，我们不做最后一名，争取往前冲。”

translation: She felt excited and said “Okay”.
transcript: 她说：“好”，很高兴的。

translation: I was the last to begin, however, that day due to some unexpected problems.
transcript: 结果第二天出了点问题，出发的时候我变成了最后一个。

translation: Looking at my daughter, her expression suggested something was wrong, so I asked, “What's wrong, Fei?”
transcript: 我回头一看，我女儿脸色已经不对了，我说：“小菲，怎么了？”

translation: “Dad, I don't trust you anymore,” she answered.
transcript: 她说：“爸爸，我不信任你了。”

translation: Well, that sounded serious, so I asked why.
transcript: 我一听这个事儿严重了，我说：“为什么。”

translation: She complained, “In the previous days when I walked with mom, I started as early as possible, and I kept in the middle of the team, but still ended up last; now you promised to take me with you and promised me I will not be last any more, but that has already happened.”
transcript: 她说：“因为前两天前三天我跟妈妈一块儿出发的时候，我都尽可能的是走在中间，早出发，但是我还是最后一个；今天你说带着我走，不当最后一名，可是我现在已经是最后一名了。”

translation: We’ve lost the day’s walk even though we haven’t started yet.
transcript: 还没出发呢，输在起跑线上了。

translation: When it came to her trust in me, I felt I had to treat the matter seriously.
transcript: 我一听我说这个事儿非常严重，我说牵扯到女儿对爸爸的信任问题。

translation: So I made up my mind and told her, “No matter what happens today, we will not be last, and we’ll at least try to be second to last.”
transcript: 于是我下定决心，我说今天无论如何我都让你不当最后一名， 哪怕是倒数第二。

translation: I explained to her, “Well, today our trick is to ‘walk slowly but never stop’. I believe as long as we keep walking and take no rests when others do, we will certainly not be the last."
transcript: 于是我就跟她讲，我说：“好，咱们今天的策略叫‘不怕慢就怕站’，我们就不停，我们就慢慢地走，别人休息我们不休息，我相信我们一定不会是最周这个最后一名。”

translation: Then we started, my daughter following with uncertainty in her mind.
transcript: 于是我们俩就出发了，女儿就将信将疑地跟我走了。

translation: Later I decided that we would rest for 5 minutes after an hour’s walk, and then continued to walk on and on.
transcript: 后来自己定了个规则，大概走一个小时休息五分钟，然后就不停地往前走。

translation: Much to my surprise, we were almost at the middle of the team when we had covered half of the route.
transcript: 结果走到了这个路的中段的时候，居然我们就走到了这个队伍的靠近中间这个部分了。

translation: Then we and the team took breaks successively, and after a while my daughter said to me, “Dad, let's go.”
transcript: 我们跟那个大部队交叉停下来休息，然后休息了一会儿，我我这个我女儿又说，说：”爸爸，赶紧往前走吧。”

translation: "Don’t be hasty, we have already caught up, so there’s nothing to be worried about,” I replied.
transcript: 我说：“着什么急，咱已经追上来了，没事儿。”

translation: “No, I cannot walk quickly enough, so if we rest longer, I am afraid I won’t be able to catch up,” she insisted.
transcript: 她说：”不行，我走得慢，如果咱再歇一会儿，我又跟不上了。”

translation: Then I realized that she really cared about this, so we marched on.
transcript: 我一听，我说这孩子怎么还很重视这件事儿，于是我就跟她一块走，我们就出发了。

translation: This is a picture taken by someone else when we almost arrived at the terminal point, where we found that we were among the first half of the team to make it to the destination.
transcript: 这是我们快到终点的时候，有一个人出来给我们拍了张照片，我们非常高兴地发现我们居然是在整个队伍的前半部分抵达的终点。

translation: My daughter and I were very satisfied that day.
transcript: 那天我跟我女儿是非常地高兴。

translation: At supper, we ate at the same table, and she sat opposite of me.
transcript: 然后晚上吃饭的时候 ，我们在一个桌子上，她在我的对面坐着。

translation: Around us were several team members, all grown-ups.
transcript: 然后周围是我们几个伙伴，都是都是大人啊。

translation: “I could not make it to the end today without my daughter,” I said.
transcript: 我就感慨地说了一声，我说：“今天我走下来完全是因为我女儿。”

translation: Then my daughter said to me without even raising her head, “Actually I made it all because of my dad.”
transcript: 这时候我女儿头都没抬地跟我来了句说：“其实我走下来也是因为我爸爸。”

translation: I can tell you now, what I felt at that moment was like hearing the collapsing of the wall in my heart.
transcript: 我当时心里头的感觉，跟大家讲，一点不夸张地讲，心里头的感觉啊，就好像你耳朵里能听到那个心里头那堵墙“哗”就倒掉了。

translation: From that day on, I felt that there were no more misunderstandings between me and my daughter.
transcript: 我从那天开始我就觉得我跟我女儿之间再也没有任何的隔阂。

translation: Perhaps I still won’t have much to say when we are together the next time.
transcript: 可能我们以后在一块儿的时候，我依然是没有任何话讲。

translation: But I reckon when people keep silent being together, odds are that either they feel awkward, don’t know what to say, or they feel delighted and don’t feel the need to express it.
transcript: 但是我想人和人在一起，如果是沉默的状态，其实只有两种可能：一种可能他们很尴尬，不知道该说什么；另外一种可能，他们很幸福，不需要用语言表达。

translation: I believe we were the latter.
transcript: 我想我们是后者。

translation: This episode may have just been progress in our parent-child relationship.
transcript: 但这件事呢，其实可能是只是感情上的一个小突破。

translation: But I think it was a memorable experience, because it led to something valuable three years later after the walk.
transcript: 但真正让我从理智上认为它是一件值得纪念的事，是在那个三年之后，走过这次戈壁的三年之后。

translation: When we came back from the Gobi, I told my daughter that it was very rewarding to walk with her.
transcript: 因为这次戈壁走完之后，我跟我女儿说了一句话。

translation: It strengthened our bond and gave me an opportunity to know more about her.
transcript: 我说爸爸觉得跟孩子一起走这条路，感觉对我们这种亲情的沟通啊，感觉特别好。

translation: I said in the future I’d like to hold a coming-of-age ceremony in the Gobi Desert, in which parents are expected to walk with their children along this route.
transcript: 我说我将来一定要搞一个戈壁成人礼，让父母带着孩子走这条路。

translation: Three years later we did hold one—the first coming-of-age ceremony in the Gobi Desert.
transcript: 那么三年之后，我们正式地搞了一届，可以说是第一届正式的大的戈壁成人礼。

translation: We expected to receive at least fifty children and their parents, with more than a hundred people in total.
transcript: 有五十多个孩子，连上他们的父母大概有一百多人。

translation: When my daughter heard the news, she insisted that she come too.
transcript: 我女儿听到这个消息的时候说：“我一要定去。”

translation: She was already fourteen then.
transcript: 那时候她已经将近十四了嘛。

translation: I must attend, she said.
transcript: 她说：“我一定要去。”

translation: "Well, then come and join us," I told her.
transcript: 我说：“好啊，你就过来吧。”

translation: I was curious about her intentions, however.
transcript: 但是我也很奇怪你为什么要来。

translation: Walking in the Gobi Desert, in my opinion, is a rather painful experience.
transcript: 因为我觉得走戈壁是件很痛苦的事情。

translation: Then four days later—four arduous days—all of the children shared their experiences with us, including my daughter, and what she shared was very touching to her mother and me.
transcript: 结果同样的四天，同样艰苦的四天走完之后，我们的孩子们在台上一起分享，我女儿也在台上，她说了一段话，让我和她妈妈在底下听得非常感动。

translation: She said, “Actually this time my walking in the Gobi Desert is a gift that I am going to present to my parents”
transcript: 她说：“其实我今天来，是为了用我走路这件事儿，给我的爸爸妈妈送一个礼物。”

translation: “When I first came here three years ago, my dad told me that he would hold a coming-of-age ceremony here.”
transcript: 她说：“因为三年前我第一次走戈壁的时候，我爸爸跟我讲他要组织一个戈壁成人礼。

translation: “Three years passed, and now we have more than fifty children with us.”
transcript: “今天三年以后了，我看到已经有五十多个孩子来走这条路了。”

translation: "Wenchuan suffered a catastrophic quake two years ago," she continued, "and my parents intended to organize a voluntary relief team when they watched the news with tears in their eyes."
transcript: 两年前，正好是汶川地震，她说，我爸爸妈妈看着电视流泪的时候就说，说我们想组织一个志愿救援队。

translation: “Now it’s already two years since the foundation of this voluntary team.”
transcript: 她说，现在这个救援队已经两周年了。

translation: “One year ago,” she said, “my parents talked about a 10km run for health concerns, so they called up their friends and then went jogging 10km every week.”
transcript: “一年前”，她说，爸爸妈妈商量说要做一个十公里健康走，就号召我们身边的朋友们运动起来，每周跑一个十公里。

translation: “A few days ago, we just celebrated the first anniversary of this running initiative.”
transcript: 她说：“就在前不久，前几天，我们刚刚一起庆祝了十公里健康走一周年。”

translation: “Although we are together every day, I find my parents are quite busy, and they let me do whatever I want.”
transcript: 她说：“我在爸爸妈妈身边，我发现他们很忙，整天也不管我，和放羊一样带着我。”

translation: This was a complaint.
transcript: 这是控诉。

translation: “Now I finally realize what they were busy doing and that they will always keep their word.”
transcript: “但是，我今天终于知道了他们在忙一些什么，我也终于知道了他们的承诺，他们都会兑现 。”

translation: I felt moved; then it struck me that although our child is silent and rarely talks, she is always watching us.
transcript: 这个事儿让我非常地感动，我这时候才知道其实孩子在身边非常沉默的，什么也不说的，她都在盯着你 。

translation: Our school advocates the motto of, “Belief, Action and Persistence”.
transcript: 我们学堂之中有一句口号叫做“理想、行动、坚持”。

translation: I can find no better case to practice this motto than walking in the Gobi Desert  together with your child, or fulfilling a tough task together and making a promise to her and keeping your word.
transcript: 我相信没有任何一件事，能够比和这个孩子一起去完成走戈壁这样一件事儿，或者去完成一个艰难的任务，并且跟她发出承诺，并且完成它，更能够体现这句话。

translation: Despite that it’s already been three years, I’d like to say to my daughter that we will continue to do those three things we promised, and see them become better and better."
transcript: 其实离这件事儿过去又三年了，我其实特别想跟我女儿讲，我们承诺的这三件事，我们依然在做，而且做得更好。

translation: I also believe that in the future my daughter can properly put into practice the motto of, "Belief, Action and Persistence".
transcript: 我也相信我女儿未来也会把这个“理想、行动、坚持”更好地放到她的生活里。

translation: That's the first thing I want to share with you.
transcript: 这是我想跟大家分享的第一件事。

translation: In fact, children always surprise us in one way or another.
transcript: 其实孩子有很多让我们意外的地方。

translation: Here is a question for you.
transcript: 比如说我问大家一个问题。

translation: Among our walkers who had been to the Gebi, we have kids from seven and a half years, the youngest, to eighteen, young people in their twenties, and people above forty .
transcript: 你们觉得如果我们从我们走过戈壁的最小的是七岁半的孩子，然后到十八岁这个年龄段的孩子，就是 “孩子”统称为；然后青年人，二十多岁的青年人；再加上四十岁以上。

translation: Are we middle aged?
transcript: 我们算中年人吗？

translation: I prefer to say that we are still young.
transcript: 中青年吧哈。

translation: So which age group do you think was most likely to cover the entire route without a ride?
transcript: 四十岁以上的朋友们，四十岁以上到老年人，这三个阶段，你们觉得哪一个阶段的，哪一个阶段的人完整地走下来戈壁，不放弃、不上车的比例是最高的？

translation: Which one?
transcript: 嗯？

translation: The middle aged?
transcript: 中青年？

translation: Kids?
transcript: 小孩儿？

translation: Yes, it was them.
transcript: 对，孩子。

translation: When I raise this question, you may suppose that young men would definitely have the most satisfying performance.
transcript: 其实我问这个问题的时候，大家就应该不意外，因为正常的思维你一定会觉得年轻力壮的小伙子们是最好的。

translation: I found during my first walk, however, that less young men in their twenties could make it than those in their forties.
transcript: 但是我们第一次走戈壁的时候，我就发现二十多岁的人走完全程的比例低于四十岁以上的人。

translation: I thought maybe this was because those in their forties have experienced a lot in their lives, so they could bear more pressure and suffering and hold on to the end.
transcript: 当时我们的理解是觉得，可能是因为四十岁以上的人生活经历多了，能够承受的压力和苦难多了，所以他走下来了。

translation: I came across a strange phenomenon in our first coming-of-age ceremony—the one attended by my daughter.
transcript: 可是我们做了第一届戈壁成人礼，就是我女儿第二次参加的这次，我就有一个意外的发现。

translation: At the end of the first day’s journey, the guide told me, “It’s very strange, I have walked this route so many times, yet this is the only day that all the members walked to the end without taking a ride. I guess we have set a record.”
transcript: 因为第一天走完戈壁，我们收队的这个队员就跟我讲，说很奇怪，说今天我创了个记录，说我们走了这么多次了，唯一的一天所有人都没有上车，都走下来了。

translation: That day the children walked with their parents.
transcript: 那一天是孩子、父母一起向前走。

translation: And it was to our great surprise that all of the children were so persistent.
transcript: 嗯？当时我们觉得这很意外，孩子们走得很好啊。

translation: On the following two days, those children walked by themselves.
transcript: 第二天第三天是孩子们自己独立向前走，自己组队向前走。

translation: And when the second day came to an end, our guide told me just like he did the last time, “All the children walked to the end, and no one took rides, except for their parents.”
transcript: 到第二天收队的时候，我们这个收队的同事又跟我讲，今天孩子们依然没有上车，全都走下来了，爹妈们上车了。

translation: It was easier to figure out why parents took rides, maybe because they wanted to arrive early and put up tents for their children.
transcript: 我觉得爹妈上车可以理解，因为他们急着到营地给孩子扎帐篷去。

translation: This was totally acceptable.
transcript: 可以接受，可以理解。

translation: I couldn’t see the reason why the children didn't take rides.
transcript: 孩子们不上车，还有点儿没理解。

translation: Later I realized that children recover from fatigue very quickly.
transcript: 当然我后来发现还孩子们恢复得很快。

translation: Some of them would cry due to the long journey, but shortly after arriving at the camp, they would become playful again.
transcript: 到了营地过一会儿，有的孩子到了营地走得直哭，但到了营地过了一会儿就好了，开始玩儿去了。

translation: So I thought it’s no wonder that they didn’t take rides.
transcript: 我就想可能是因为孩子自然恢复的快，没什么可奇怪的。

translation: On the third day, a child took a ride due to physical reasons, and a girl attended to her.
transcript: 但是第三天有一个孩子因为身体的原因上了车了，另外一个女生呢就陪着她一块儿上了车。

translation: That night, the children sat together to share their stories, and the one who took a ride said, “To tell you the truth, today I met a member who felt uncomfortable, so she got in the car, and I also felt very tired. So I said to myself why not get on, too?”
transcript: 到了晚上 ，孩子们坐到一块儿分享，结果这个上车的孩子呢就说到这件事，就说哎呀，非常难过地讲，说今天我确实因为谁谁谁不舒服，她想上车了，我一想哎呀，我也特别累，我说我陪着她吧，我们就一块儿上了收容车？

translation: Then I heard the crowd respond in astonishment, “Huh? We can ride that car?”
transcript: 这时候我就听见周围这帮孩子们，噢？原来还可以上车啊？

translation: All of a sudden, I realized that they didn’t even know that they could get in the car.
transcript: 我恍然大悟，原来他们是不知道可以上车。

translation: I also found out why these three categories performed as they did.
transcript: 但是我随即又解开了一个谜，我就知道为什么刚才我说的这个数字会有这样一个分布。

translation: For the children, they didn’t ride the car because they didn’t know that they could.
transcript: 孩子们之所以不上车是因为他不知道有上车这个选择。

translation: They thought that the only choice for them was to walk to the end.
transcript: 他认为只有一个选择就是我要走下来。

translation: As for those in their forties, they might have conceded that they have lived nearly half of their lives, and with few choices left, this was it—walk to the end and finally achieve something.
transcript: 四十岁以上的人之所以不上车，是因为他也知道，我四十多岁了啊，我这辈子没有太多的选择了，就这样吧，好好干，干成了我这辈子就行了。

translation: Or, if not, yield to fate.
transcript: 干不成这辈子也就这样了。

translation: So they were unwilling to try other choices.
transcript: 所以四十岁的人他潜意识当中他不会再愿意做更多的选择。

translation: Only those who were young in their twenties and freshly graduated from university had many chances before them.
transcript: 只有二十多岁的孩子们，二十多岁的青年人， 刚毕业，正是在青春选择的时期，OK呀，他有多多的选择。

translation: We, on the other hand, have fewer opportunities, so all we can do is to mind each step on the path we have chosen.
transcript: 我们却没有了，没有太多的机会了，所以我们要认认真真走好脚下这条路。

translation: This is the inspiration I got from the children.
transcript: 这是孩子们的无意当中给的我的一个启发。

translation: You may also believe that they can do better with fewer choices.
transcript: 而且你也相信当他们没有选择的时候，他们能做得非常好。

translation: On the contrary, they are offered too many choices, and any choice that is not made or fulfilled by themselves is not a good one at all.
transcript: 可是问题是他们在生活当中往往意味着选择太多，所以任何一个选择，只要不是孩子自己做出来的，不是孩子自己去实践的，都不会是好的选择。

translation: The third story I’d like to share is that during the walk, a teenager of about thirteen told us that after the journey he realized that pain makes his existence more real.
transcript: 第三个事，我们那次分享的时候，台上有一个十三四岁的孩子说了一句话，他说：“走完戈壁之后我才发现，原来疼痛能使我更加真实的知道我的存在。”

translation: It’s astonishing that such a young child can draw such a philosophical conclusion.
transcript: 一个孩子他能有这样一个非常哲学性的总结，非常超乎我们的意外。

translation: He didn’t receive any professional training, so how could he speak such profound words?
transcript: 因为他的大脑，他的思维并没有经过这样的哲学化的训练，他怎么能说出这样哲学化的话呢？

translation: When I was young, I always thought that children are a gift from Heaven, and that god will often deliver messages to us through our children.
transcript: 小时候我经常觉得孩子是上帝送的一个礼物，他经常会把上帝带给你的一些神秘的信息，透过他的嘴传递给你。

translation: Nowadays, we are rethinking to define what “thinking” is.
transcript: 今天我们是rethinking，什么是思想呢。

translation: Does everyone recognize this character?
transcript: 大家认识这个字吗？

translation: Yes, it reads “si”, and it’s the earliest written form that we can find.
transcript: “思”，没错，我们现在能查到的最早的“思”字儿的写法 。

translation: Look at the upper part, does it look like a head?
transcript: 上面是一个，像不像一个头？

translation: Actually, this part reads “xin”, referring to the fontanel, or the soft, boneless area of a baby’s skull.
transcript: 这个其实那个“囟”，就是小孩头脑顶上那个没有封的那个骨头，叫囟门，“囟”字。

translation: What’s the lower part?
transcript: 底下是个什么呀？

translation: “Xin”, known as heart today.
transcript: “心”，就是我们今天很熟悉的心。

translation: Our ancestors believed that thinking was the product of the head and the heart.
transcript: 所以古人就认为思想这件事，思考这件事，是大脑加心灵的共同的工作。

translation: The head alone cannot think, and we can see in Chinese writing that any character denoting thought has a “heart” component.
transcript: 思考的事不是光靠大脑能完成的，你看任何一个跟“思”有关系的“思想”，“想”字也是带着心。

translation: Thinking is not independent of the heart; and without the heart, thinking is not genuine.
transcript: 如果没有心，思考是不成立的，不是真正整体的思考。

translation: Well, imagine how can a student score highly in a math contest?
transcript: 反过头来我们再看一看我们今天的奥数？

translation: Must he use his heart or his head?
transcript: 用的上面部分还是下面部分？

translation: The results of the College Entrance Exam were released lately.
transcript: 高考分数刚发。

translation: Is it a test of the head or the heart?
transcript: 高考的分数考的是上面这部分还是下面这部分？

translation: What is education like in our schools?
transcript: 学校课堂教育？

translation: Is it about the head or the heart?
transcript: 教的是上面那部分还是下面这部分？

translation: If you hope that your child can be a true grown-up in the future, then travel with him, face challenges with him, and solve problems with him.
transcript: 所以如果我们希望我们的孩子未来成一个完整的人，多和他一起出去走一走，多和他一起去面对挑战，多和他一起去解决困难。

translation: Only then can you truly know your child and help him to be a fully developed person.
transcript: 你才会真正地跟孩子打破你心中的隔阂，真正让他成为一个完整的人。

translation: To be honest, I had a sweet encounter today.
transcript: 说到最后呢，其实我今天还有一个甜蜜的偶遇。

translation: My daughter went traveling with her classmates after graduating from high school, and I don’t know where they went until today when I arrived at Shanghai and discovered that she is here, too.
transcript: 因为恰好今天，我女儿是高中毕业以后的毕业旅行，和同学们一起毕业旅行，正好今天到上海，我之前都不知道，到这我才知道她们正好今天到上海。

translation: So I invited my daughter, right there, Fei.
transcript: 所以我让我女儿也过来了，在那儿，小菲。

translation: In fact, I brought a gift for her.
transcript: 我其实给她今天也特别带了一个小礼物。

translation: It’s a video we recorded three years ago when we went traveling in the Gobi Desert.
transcript: 就是我们三年前一起走戈壁的时候，我们做的那个片子。

translation: Now I’d like to watch it with you.
transcript: 我想和大家一起看一下这个片子，回顾下这个片子。

translation: By playing this video, I want to tell my daughter that this trip is not truly a graduation trip, as you will have far more meaningful trips in the future while expanding your horizons.
transcript: 我也想透过这片子呢，对我女儿讲，其实今天的毕业旅行，还并不是真正的毕业旅行，我们真正面对人生的毕业旅行，在未来的不久将真正的走出去。

translation: We are not likely to have an encounter like this, however, when you’re in the wider world.
transcript: 也许在那之后，我们很少会有机会在一个偌大的世界里，像今天一样甜蜜的偶遇了。

translation: But no matter what chance we have, no matter how far you go, you will always receive love and blessings from your mother and me, just as the song in this video will accompany you forever.
transcript: 但是不管有没有这样的机会，不管将来你的毕业旅行会走得多远，爸爸妈妈的爱，爸爸妈妈的祝福，都会像这个片子的那支歌一样永远的伴随着你。

translation: Thank you all!
transcript: 谢谢大家!
